title: Why the 4% Rule Doesn't Work
subtitle: Explore the shortcomings of the 4% rule and consider more personalized strategies for retirement.
content:
Why the 4% Rule Doesn't Work

Here is exactly why the 4% rule doesn’t work.

1. Based on Past Returns

It’s based on past returns, not future needs. Nostalgia is not a retirement strategy.

2. Assumes No Major Life Changes

The 4% rule assumes no major life changes, like, say, I don’t know, divorce, illness, or moving to Vermont to raise goats.

3. Ignores Actual Spending Patterns

It doesn’t account for your actual spending patterns. It’s just a theoretical model built in the 90s based on worst-case scenarios.

Conclusion

It’s not a rule, it’s definitely not a plan. It’s just a guess—much like everything else in life that we pretend to know but don’t.

If any of this is helpful, check out the episode of the podcast where I analyze the 4% rule and all of its nuance and glory.
